intro: Manettia echitidea, commonly known as the velvetleaf or white-flowered manettia, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often velvety to the touch. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Manettia echitidea is native to Central and South America and is often found in shaded, humid environments.
